When Ciaran, Blade of the Lords enters the battlefield, each opponent chooses a creature card name.
Ciaran can't be blocked except by creatures with one of the chosen names.

rulings.text: Only names of actual creature cards can be used. For example, Wandering Fumarole cannot be named even if a Wandering Fumarole on the battlefield is currently a creature. Similarly, most tokens cannot be named, with the exception of tokens with names that are also creature card names. At the time of this ruling, the only such tokens other than token copies are Assembly-Worker, Cloud Sprite, Festering Goblin, Goldmeadow Harrier, Kobolds of Kher Keep, Llanowar Elves, Metallic Sliver, Nightmare, Shapeshifter, and Spark Elemental.

rulings.text: The last ability makes it so instead of sacrificing a specific creature (e.g. because of a desperation effect or a spell like Final Answer), your opponent can sacrifice any two of their creatures.
Sacrificing creatures as a cost to cast a spell or activate an ability is not affected by Kalameet.
